Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Dozens of people lined the sidewalks that had been swept just hours prior, fussing with their belongings, setting up new tents, and discreetly selling wares to one another.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: A visit to Jessie and Sixth streets in SoMa after the rally showed how futile these sweeps can be.

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to Public Works policy, staff are supposed to provide the resident of an encampment a “reasonable amount of time (approximately 30 minutes)” to sort through and collect their belongings before the camp is torn down.
Document Sources.Source Justification: According to Public Works policy, staff are supposed to provide the resident of an encampment a “reasonable amount of time (approximately 30 minutes)” to sort through and collect their belongings before the camp is torn down.

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: A federal survey released in May counted more than 8,000 unhoused people in the city, which has fewer than 4,000 shelter beds to offer.
Document Sources.Source Justification: A federal survey released in May counted more than 8,000 unhoused people in the city, which has fewer than 4,000 shelter beds to offer.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The 38-year-old had chosen to set up camp near Palou Ave. and Griffith St. in Hunters Point, on a dead-end road surrounded by industrial buildings.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: On a grey Thursday morning last week, Antonio Robinson watched as a coterie of cops, workers from the city Department of Public Works, and a pair of outreach specialists descended on his tent.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Robinson’s last encampment was swept about a month ago, and “nearly everything” was taken, including his state ID card, he said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Robinson’s last encampment was swept about a month ago, and “nearly everything” was taken, including his state ID card, he said.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Despite Public Works’ policy and procedure for documenting, bagging, and tagging most belongings, Robinson said he was unable to find any of his property at the city’s mandated storage facility at 2323 Cesar Chavez St.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Despite Public Works’ policy and procedure for documenting, bagging, and tagging most belongings, Robinson said he was unable to find any of his property at the city’s mandated storage facility at 2323 Cesar Chavez St.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Robinson may have dodged a citation, but his neighbor wasn’t so lucky.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Robinson may have dodged a citation, but his neighbor wasn’t so lucky.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Joey O’Brien, 46, tried to explain to police officers that he was camping on the sidewalk in Hunters Point while investigating a homicide that occurred while he was in jail.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Joey O’Brien, 46, tried to explain to police officers that he was camping on the sidewalk in Hunters Point while investigating a homicide that occurred while he was in jail.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: After listening for about two minutes, an officer told him that he was being detained for illegal lodging, then put O’Brien in cuffs and led him to a patrol vehicle away from his camp.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: After listening for about two minutes, an officer told him that he was being detained for illegal lodging, then put O’Brien in cuffs and led him to a patrol vehicle away from his camp.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: O’Brien was polite and contrite, admitting that he had broken several windows in the past while suffering a mental breakdown.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: O’Brien was polite and contrite, admitting that he had broken several windows in the past while suffering a mental breakdown.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: More than anything, however, he begged for officers to bring over his two neat backpacks, which had his best clothes, documents, and “bits of silver.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: More than anything, however, he begged for officers to bring over his two neat backpacks, which had his best clothes, documents, and “bits of silver.”

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Public Works employees began examining and collecting O’Brien’s possessions as soon as he was detained, without giving him the sorting time required by policy.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Public Works employees began examining and collecting O’Brien’s possessions as soon as he was detained, without giving him the sorting time required by policy.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Eventually, an officer brought a black backpack to O’Brien, but gestured to the truck, now indiscriminately piled high with his property.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Eventually, an officer brought a black backpack to O’Brien, but gestured to the truck, now indiscriminately piled high with his property.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “The other stuff is under all that over there,” the officer said with a shrug. “You’re going to have to pick it up later.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: “The other stuff is under all that over there,” the officer said with a shrug. “You’re going to have to pick it up later.”

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Many unhoused people, including Robinson, say it can be challenging to identify and retrieve their belongings at the facility.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Many unhoused people, including Robinson, say it can be challenging to identify and retrieve their belongings at the facility.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: When they succeed, they often find important pieces missing from their stash — a problem that has persisted over years of sweeps.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: When they succeed, they often find important pieces missing from their stash — a problem that has persisted over years of sweeps.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Instead, the city swooped down on the encampments at Sixth and Jessie streets earlier than scheduled, said Julian Highsmith, communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Instead, the city swooped down on the encampments at Sixth and Jessie streets earlier than scheduled, said Julian Highsmith, communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Typically, with city sweeps, they give 72 hours of notice with location and time, and we were following that, but they didn’t follow that usual rule,” Highsmith said.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: “Typically, with city sweeps, they give 72 hours of notice with location and time, and we were following that, but they didn’t follow that usual rule,” Highsmith said.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Highsmith told Gazetteer he believes the city may have gotten wind of the group’s planned sweep disruption and undercut it in order to prevent unhoused people from organizing with their advocates during an enforcement.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Highsmith told Gazetteer he believes the city may have gotten wind of the group’s planned sweep disruption and undercut it in order to prevent unhoused people from organizing with their advocates during an enforcement.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I personally think it’s a little suspicious to do the sweep earlier. It doesn’t seem like the city wants attention on the encampment sweeps, and I don’t think they want people to see what happens during that process,” he said.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: “I personally think it’s a little suspicious to do the sweep earlier. It doesn’t seem like the city wants attention on the encampment sweeps, and I don’t think they want people to see what happens during that process,” he said.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: When asked where he would move next, he shrugged and noted in his characteristic whisper that he was staying in the neighborhood.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: When asked where he would move next, he shrugged and noted in his characteristic whisper that he was staying in the neighborhood.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “It’s quiet here,” he said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: “It’s quiet here,” he said.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Then he piled one last bag on his already overloaded wagon, pulled it across the street from his old camp, and sat down on the sidewalk to figure it out.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Then he piled one last bag on his already overloaded wagon, pulled it across the street from his old camp, and sat down on the sidewalk to figure it out.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: According to Mayor London Breed, the intention is to clean up sidewalks and force unhoused people into the city’s labyrinthine network of shelter and supportive housing programs.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: According to Mayor London Breed, the intention is to clean up sidewalks and force unhoused people into the city’s labyrinthine network of shelter and supportive housing programs.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: In a response to Gazetteer's questions about potential breaches in protocol, Public Works spokesperson Rachel Gordon only noted that "the policy clearly spells out how soiled items can be handled and our crews follow the policy and consistently apply its terms."
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: In a response to Gazetteer's questions about potential breaches in protocol, Public Works spokesperson Rachel Gordon only noted that "the policy clearly spells out how soiled items can be handled and our crews follow the policy and consistently apply its terms."

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Gordon said claims for lost property can be filed with the City Attorney's office.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Gordon said claims for lost property can be filed with the City Attorney's office.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Mayor Breed's office did not respond to requests for comment.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Mayor Breed's office did not respond to requests for comment.
